title: Typeface similar to Big Caslon, but less contrasted?
content:
I’m looking for a typeface similar to Big Caslon, but less contrasted. Anybody have some good suggestions?

Thanks a lot :)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Screen Shot 2014-12-28 at 22.19.38.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317153812/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202014-12-28%20at%2022.19.38.png) | 53.59 KB |
author: RuneBS

comments.content: Caslon 540 is closest, with less contrast than Big Caslon. Adobe Caslon has less than 540. My Williams Caslon Text [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/WilliamsCaslonText/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317153812/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/WilliamsCaslonText/ "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/WilliamsCaslonText/") has still less. The bold on mine, which has higher contrast than the regular, will work at bigger than text sizes.

¶ Apart from the solid _Adobe Caslon_, you can try:  
 [Caslon Classico](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317153812/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/caslon-classico/) by Franko Luin  
 [Kings Caslon](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317153812/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/daltonmaag/kings-caslon/) (Dalton Maag) by Marc Weymann, Ron Carpenter
